page.title: 18CHURCH UNITY IN RHYL
page.content: There are many different churches in Rhyl including Anglican, Baptist, Apostolic, Methodist, Roman Catholic, Presbyterian, Seventh Day Adventist, United Reform and Salvation Army. WELSH SPEAKING - Anglican, Methodist and Presbyterian. The Vicar of Rhyl states that in 1975 a covenant was signed between the Anglican, Presbyterian, Methodist and United Reform Churches to work together for unity. They have held several joint services of Holy Communion when they have all come to- gether in each other's churches. There is also a Council of Churches in Rhyl with representatives from ALL churches and this Council meets regularly and a president is appointed annually. They have united services and work together especially during Christian Aid Week. The ministers meet together bi-monthly
